meanings.definition: The quality or state of being soft and compressible like a sponge.
meanings.sent1: The sponginess of the mattress made it very comfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the sponginess of the soil made it easy to dig in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The sponginess of the marshmallow made it fun to squish between my fingers.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt heavy with sponginess, absorbing all the sadness around her.
meanings.sent5: The sponginess of the bread made it perfect for soaking up the soup.

meanings.definition: The ability to absorb or retain moisture like a sponge.
meanings.sent1: The sponginess of the paper towel allowed it to soak up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The plant's sponginess helped it survive in the dry desert climate.
meanings.sent3: His explanation had a sponginess that seemed to absorb all the doubts in the room.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor had a sponginess to it, soaking up the rain like a giant sponge.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's sponginess made it perfect for cleaning up spills in the kitchen.
